string-array.name: pref_example_list_titles
string-array.item: Always
When possible
Never

string-array.name: issues_ted_cruz
string-array.item: Enforces the law against millions of illegal immigrants in America. Believes illegal immigrants are economic distress for lower-income Americans.
Prayed against Supreme Court decision on same-sex marriage legalization.
Believes everyone should have right education whether public, private, or others. Supports ending racial preferences for college admissions.
Strongly in favor of the second amendment. Strongly against gun restrictions.
Demands a Balanced Budget amendment. Balance budget amendment to prevent bankruptcy.
In favor of repealing ObamaCare. Raise eligible age on Medicare.
Not in favor of protecting ocean, costal, and Great Lakes ecosystems.
Believes our allies need America for leadership. Wants to break diplomatic relations with Cuba.

string-array.name: issues_donald_trump
string-array.item: Wants to ban Muslims from coming to America. Believes illegal immigration hurts America’s economy.
Believes same-sex marriage is a state issue. Does not support gay marriage and against same-sex partner benefits.
Do not forgive federal student loans, but take ways to help students pay back. In favor of schools competing for student applicants.
Strongly in favor of the second amendment. Believes gun control influences gun violence.
Massive tariffs on China and Mexico. Not in favor of increasing the minimum wage.
Believes in universal health care. Wants to replace Obamacare with health saving accounts.
Believes Environmental Protection is a disgrace because they bring new regulations.
Wants China to deal with North Korea and make its dictator dead. Believes China is controlling North Korea. Views Russia as a crucial relationship in diplomacy and respect.

string-array.name: issues_john_kasich
string-array.item: Legalize illegal immigrants with fine and taxes. In favor of more immigrant visas for skilled and experienced workers.
Accepts Supreme Court ruling on same-sex marriage.
Daughters have to attend Christian schools. Bible stories are considered historical facts.
In favor of keeping gun restrictions, but tighten up terrorist firearms. Strongly against gun restrictions.
In favor of Balanced Budget amendment. Economic uncertainty worries working families.
Wants to expand Medicaid. Strongly opposes ObamaCare and government-run healthcare.
Proposed $300 million investment for hurricane protection and costal restoration.
Believes China has control on North Korea. Believes China does not have control over South China Sea. Wants to bring the U.S. Navy to the sea.

string-array.name: issues_hillary_clinton
string-array.item: In favor of in-state tuition for illegal immigrants. Give opportunity for illegal immigrants to become U.S. citizens.
Supports gay marriage and the law for it.
Wants schools to teach discipline, self-control, and patience. Believes bible is part of history and literature, not part of science or religion.
In favor of giving states and cities control on local gun laws. Limit access to firearms to citizens.
In favor of reducing corporate power. Believes the economy is not in favor for the middle-class.
Believes Medicare is not economically feasible. Healthcare should be available to all children. No national ban on smoking cigarettes.
Advocates green energy jobs. In favor of scrutinizing exposures to toxic materials.
Believes America as the indispensable nation. Prioritizes helping people first than committing troops.

string-array.name: issues_bernie_sanders
string-array.item: Wants to give opportunity for illegal immigrants to become U.S. citizens. Wants to secure borders around U.S. without building a fence.
Believes that no matter what sexual orientation, everyone has the right to love each other.
Wants free education (including college) for low income students. Wants tuition-free for public colleges.
Believes citizens have the right to buy firearms. Wants to tighten background checks in gun control.
Believes root causes of economic inequality needs to be addressed. Economic issues are far out reached for the minority groups.
Believes in Medicare for all citizens. Helped in ObamaCare policy and wants to extend it more to 29 million uninsured citizens.
Believes genetically modified organisms need to be labeled. In favor of protecting ocean, coastal, and Great Lakes ecosystems.
Wants America to be open to Syrian refugees. Wants China to deal with North Korea. Wants to promote democracy in China.

resources.string: The Republican Party is fighting for a freer and stronger America where everyone has the opportunity to achieve the American Dream.
Democrats believe that we\'re greater together than we are on our own—that this country succeeds when everyone gets a fair shot, everyone does their fair share, and everyone plays by the same rules.
As Libertarians, we seek a world of liberty; a world in which all individuals are sovereign over their own lives and no one is forced to sacrifice his or her values for the benefit of others.
An electoral alternative to a two-party system. The party\'s first priority is value-based politics. Acts to improve the quality of our environment and everyday lives.

The first debate will be divided into six time segments of approximately 15 minutes each on major topics to be selected by the moderator and announced at least one week before the debate. The moderator will open each segment with a question, after which each candidate will have two minutes to respond. Candidates will then have an opportunity to respond to each other.
Lester Holt, Anchor, NBC Nightly News

The Vice Presidential debate will be divided into nine time segments of approximately 10 minutes each. The moderator will ask an opening question, after which each candidate will have two minutes to respond. The moderator will use the balance of the time in the segment for a deeper discussion of the topic.
Elaine Quijano, Anchor, CBSN, CBS News

The second presidential debate will take the form of a town meeting, in which half of the questions will be posed directly by citizen participants and the other half will be posed by the moderator based on topics of broad public interest as reflected in social media and other sources. The candidates will have two minutes to respond and there will be an additional minute for the moderator to facilitate further discussion.
Washington University in St. Louis, St. Louis, MO

The first debate will be divided into six time segments of approximately 15 minutes each on major topics to be selected by the moderator and announced at least one week before the debate. The moderator will open each segment with a question, after which each candidate will have two minutes to respond. Candidates will then have an opportunity to respond to each other. The moderator will use the balance of the time in the segment for a deeper discussion of the topic.
Chris Wallace, Anchor, Fox News Sunday
University of Nevada, Las Vegas, Las Vegas, NV

Voters will select presidential electors, who in turn will vote for a new president and vice president through the Electoral College. The term limit established in the Twenty-second Amendment to the United States Constitution prevents the incumbent president, Barack Obama of the Democratic Party, from being elected to a third term. The 2016 election will likely determine the 45th President and 48th Vice President of the United States.
No moderator this time folks, get out there and vote for your favorite candidate!
